content: @Santiago Pastorino and @pnkfelix I created the compiler-team-prioritization repository
wg-prioritization, compiler-team, compiler-team-contributors all have write access

nikomatsakis said:

Santiago Pastorino and pnkfelix I created the compiler-team-prioritization repository

thanks Niko
Should we move all our documents there?
maybe for now we could but I guess it would be better if we have our documents on forge
it could be a place to put santiago's CLI script
i don't know where that's hosted at the moment
nor do I know where triagebot source is hosted

pnkfelix said:

nor do I know where triagebot source is hosted

currently under the main rust-lang umbrella account
https://github.com/rust-lang/triagebot
Hosted: nowhere (I believe)

Santiago Pastorino said:

maybe for now we could but I guess it would be better if we have our documents on forge

@Santiago Pastorino you mean moving all or part of what we currently have here?
https://hackmd.io/team/rust-compiler-team?nav=overview

Also, speaking about documentation, I am wondering if the rust-lang/compiler-team-prioritization would be a better fit for the triagebot "technical" documentation.
I've briefly mentioned this yesterday during the meeting, moving it out of the triagebot wiki to rust-forge:
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/227806-t-compiler.2Fwg-prioritization/topic/2020-06-23.20Steering.20meeting/near/201776420

apiraino said:

Hosted: nowhere (I believe)

right, it's not hosted, anyway we will properly integrate this into triagebot
it lives in that repo but it's kind of a separate thing, different executable, different modules, etc
just lightly integrated with the github requests mechanisms

apiraino said:

Also, speaking about documentation, I am wondering if the rust-lang/compiler-team-prioritization would be a better fit for the triagebot "technical" documentation.
I've briefly mentioned this yesterday during the meeting, moving it out of the triagebot wiki to rust-forge:
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/227806-t-compiler.2Fwg-prioritization/topic/2020-06-23.20Steering.20meeting/near/201776420

if I'm not wrong we have been moving this kind of documents to forge, so I'd just place everything on forge

apiraino said:

Santiago Pastorino said:

maybe for now we could but I guess it would be better if we have our documents on forge

Santiago Pastorino you mean moving all or part of what we currently have here?
https://hackmd.io/team/rust-compiler-team?nav=overview

Yes, I meant something like that, the problem is that I think we should polish the documentation a bit better before posting on forge
@apiraino maybe take a look to the docs there, mainly our procedure and see if makes sense to you and if you can improve the wording and all that
I guess after giving a couple of passes to it we can totally migrate it to forge
for now I see 2 documents to move, the process one and what o0Ignition0o - Jeremy Lempereur was working on
but just in case, I don't think we should migrate all
would it make sense to iterate directly on a PR on rust-forge?
for instance, wouldn't migrate https://hackmd.io/LZsUQsK3T3yIc4KW81ungw?view

apiraino said:

would it make sense to iterate directly on a PR on rust-forge?

whatever you prefer is fine for me :)
ok I'll read again the fine material then humbly submit a PR to start reviewing and organizing documentation. I like the PR concept because I can render immediately how the forge would look like.
